fields.value: Replication Data for: The Dynamics of Firm Lobbying

dsDescriptionValue.value: How is economic policy made? In this paper we study a key determinant of the answer to the question: lobbying by firms. Estimating a binary choice model of firm behavior, we find significant evidence for the idea that barriers to entry induce persistence in lobbying. The existence of these costs is further confirmed in studying how firms responded to a particular policy change: the expiration of legislation relating to the H-1B visa. Due to its influence on firm behavior, we argue that this persistence fundamentally changes the environment in which legislation is made.

publicationCitation.value: Kerr, William R., William F. Lincoln, and Prachi Mishra. "The Dynamics of Firm Lobbying." American Economic Journal: Economic Policy (forthcoming).
Kerr, William R., William F. Lincoln, and Prachi Mishra. 2014. "The Dynamics of Firm Lobbying." American Economic Journal: Economic Policy, 6(4): 343-79.

files.description: This file is used to replicate Tables 1 and 2, Figures 1-4, and a number of descriptive statistics mentioned in the text of the paper.
files.label: descdata.tab

dataFile.description: This file is used to replicate Tables 1 and 2, Figures 1-4, and a number of descriptive statistics mentioned in the text of the paper.

files.description: This file is used to replicate Tables 4 and 5 as well as a number of the robustness checks reported in the text. It is also used to replicate much of Table 3 and a number of alternative ways of estimating the importance of different issues for our firm sample. The set of variables in this data set that begin with “indyr” are used to control for industry x year fixed effects.
files.label: fsregressions.tab

dataFile.description: This file is used to replicate Tables 4 and 5 as well as a number of the robustness checks reported in the text. It is also used to replicate much of Table 3 and a number of alternative ways of estimating the importance of different issues for our firm sample. The set of variables in this data set that begin with “indyr” are used to control for industry x year fixed effects.

files.description: This file is used to replicate Column 1 of Table 3 on the importance of different issues for all organizations that lobby.
